TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void ClickedEventHandler(object sender, ClickedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed ClickedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub ClickedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As ClickedEventArgs)
public delegate void ClickedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, ClickedEventArgs ^ e);
type ClickedEventHandler = delegate of obj * ClickedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a Button control.

remarks.para: The code skeleton for an event handler associated with the Clicked event, which uses the ClickedEventHandler delegate, should be added only from the Microsoft InfoPath user interface. For more information on how to add event handlers in InfoPath, see How Do I: Add an Event Handler.

example.para: For an example of using the ClickedEventHandler delegate, see the sample code in the Clicked event of the class.
